--- create_function_struct.sql
CREATE FUNCTION my_func(s STRUCT<x INT64, y STRING>) RETURNS INT64 AS (s.x)

--- AST
&ast.CreateFunction{
  As:       67,
  RparenAs: 74,
  Name:     &ast.Path{
    Idents: []*ast.Ident{
      &ast.Ident{
        NamePos: 16,
        NameEnd: 23,
        Name:    "my_func",
      },
    },
  },
  Params: []*ast.FunctionParam{
    &ast.FunctionParam{
      Name: &ast.Ident{
        NamePos: 24,
        NameEnd: 25,
        Name:    "s",
      },
      Type: &ast.StructType{
        Struct: 26,
        Gt:     50,
        Fields: []*ast.StructField{
          &ast.StructField{
            Ident: &ast.Ident{
              NamePos: 33,
              NameEnd: 34,
              Name:    "x",
            },
            Type: &ast.SimpleType{
              NamePos: 35,
              Name:    "INT64",
            },
          },
          &ast.StructField{
            Ident: &ast.Ident{
              NamePos: 42,
              NameEnd: 43,
              Name:    "y",
            },
            Type: &ast.SimpleType{
              NamePos: 44,
              Name:    "STRING",
            },
          },
        },
      },
    },
  },
  ReturnType: &ast.ScalarSchemaType{
    NamePos: 61,
    Name:    "INT64",
  },
  Definition: &ast.Path{
    Idents: []*ast.Ident{
      &ast.Ident{
        NamePos: 71,
        NameEnd: 72,
        Name:    "s",
      },
      &ast.Ident{
        NamePos: 73,
        NameEnd: 74,
        Name:    "x",
      },
    },
  },
}

--- SQL
CREATE FUNCTION my_func (s STRUCT<x INT64, y STRING>) RETURNS INT64 AS (s.x)
